name: SelectTrigger
description:
A button that opens the select popup.
Renders a `<button>` element.

nativeButton.description:
Whether the component renders a native `<button>` element when replacing it
via the `render` prop.
Set to `false` if the rendered element is not a button (e.g. `<div>`).

disabled.description: Whether the component should ignore user interaction.

className.description:
CSS class applied to the element, or a function that
returns a class based on the component’s state.

style.detailedType:
| React.CSSProperties
| ((
    state: Select.Trigger.State,
  ) => CSSProperties | undefined)
| undefined

render.description:
Allows you to replace the component’s HTML element
with a different tag, or compose it with another component.

Accepts a `ReactElement` or a function that returns the element to render.
render.detailedType:
| ReactElement
| ((
    props: HTMLProps,
    state: Select.Trigger.State,
  ) => ReactElement)

data-popup-open.description: Present when the corresponding select is open.

data-pressed.description: Present when the trigger is pressed.

data-disabled.description: Present when the select is disabled.

data-readonly.description: Present when the select is readonly.

data-required.description: Present when the select is required.

data-valid.description: Present when the select is in valid state (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-invalid.description: Present when the select is in invalid state (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-dirty.description: Present when the select's value has changed (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-touched.description: Present when the select has been touched (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-filled.description: Present when the select has a value (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-focused.description: Present when the select trigger is focused (when wrapped in Field.Root).

data-placeholder.description: Present when the select doesn't have a value.
